p: The estimated growth rate under the exponential growth model was 0.218 days −1, corresponding to an R 0 estimation of 2.6 (CI, 2.1‐5.1). The direct estimation of the doubling time of the epidemic gave a mean of 3.6 days (varying from 1.0 to 7.7). Figure 1B shows the Bayesian birth‐death skyline plot of the R e estimates with 95% HPD and indicates that R e increased from less than 1 (mean, 0.8; 95% HPD, 0.3‐1.3) to a mean value of 2.4 (95% HPD, 1.5‐3.5) in December 2019, and has since remained at this value. The estimation allowing a single R e gave a mean value of 1.85 (95% HPD, 1.37‐2.4).
